intro: Scleranthus longisetus, commonly known as the long-haired sicklegrass, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and typically grows in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its rough texture. Scleranthus longisetus is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny conditions.
